choices: Pick up the pipe and face him.
1.content:
You awake feeling as if you are suffering from amnesia. You have vague notions of having some sort of a life: a small apartment, a nondescript second-hand car, a dull office job, but none of it seems very clear. You try to think hard, remember any details to bring it into focus, but you can’t. You don’t know the street your apartment is on, the kind of car you drive, or even what your occupation is.

You suddenly catch sight of yourself in a full-length mirror on a doorway , and what you see makes you jump: You are a child again! You appear to be about twelve or thirteen years old, and you are back in the house where you lived when you were growing up.

“How could I be here? And how come I’m a kid again? What the hell is going on? I’m a grown man... or am I?” You begin to have your doubts...

“Maybe this is reality, I’m still a kid. Maybe I got hit in the head one time too many and all that other stuff is a dream of the future?”

You have little time to ponder the situation: There is a loud crash from the kitchen. Dad is in a drunken rage and you can hear your mother crying. Another typical Saturday night at home... If things play out the way they normally did, Dad will be coming up the stairs to slap you around next.

“Maybe I can go to Grandma’s, that used to work.” you think to yourself. You pick up
the phone and dial her number from memory, hoping she'll let you stay there for a while.
"Hello?" you hear her answer.

"Grandma! it’s me, can I ...” but you never get to finish.

You feel a stab of pain at the side of you head as the phone is slapped from your hand and sent flying across the floor.

"You little punk, gonna go running to your Gramma again? I'll kick your ass!" your father rages, as he shoves you backwards. You stumble over a chair and land on the floor.

"Get up on your feet and fight like a man, you sissy!" He screams at you. You notice the
bloodstained piece of pvc pipe in the corner, easily within reach. He has used this pipe many times before, to beat you and your younger sister for being "bad kids".

You notice he has also spotted the pipe, so you must move quickly.
1.title: Days of Future Passed

choices: Steal his wallet and run away
Tie him up and call the police
11.content:
You grab the piece of pipe and get up on your feet. You swing, aiming for the side of his head, but he reaches out and knocks it away easily. You dive for the pipe which has fallen to the floor, trying to get to it before he does.

He stomps your hand with his foot just as your fingers are curling around the pipe.
You hear a sickening crunch, and feel the wave of pain rush from your fingers up your arm to your terrified brain. He kicks you in the chest and you curl up, trying to protect yourself, you know the drill...

"That was a very bad thing to do to, son.” he says, with exaggerated calmness.
"And you know what happens to bad kids, right?" He picks up the pipe...

Through the haze of pain and fear you see a shadow approaching your father from behind. It's your Mom, and she's holding something.
WHAM! she slams the frying pan down on top of his head and he crumples to the floor.

You stumble over to where he is lying, to check if he is alive. You see he isn't dead, just unconscious, and you feel disappointed, then guilty for feeling that way. You kick him, hard, in the ribs, and he groans in his sleep. "How's that feel, huh pop?" But he doesn't answer.
11.title: Daddy Dearest

choices: Stick out your thumb and hitch a ride.
111.content:
You reach into his back pocket and take out his wallet. Jackpot! There’s gotta be three
hundred dollars in twenties in there, he musta had a good day at the track... You look over at your mother, crumpled on the floor next to the old man, crying.

"Are you gonna call the cops Ma?" you ask, but you already know the answer. She shakes
her head.

"Well come on with me, you know he'll kick your ass when he wakes up!" you plead. But
she continues to shake her head, no, she's too worn down, she could never leave him.

"Here, take this, you'll need it." you say, pushing half the money from the wallet into her trembling hand.
"Just tell him I took it all. Be sure to hide it somewhere safe, somewhere he won't find it."

She looks up at you and nods her head, tries to say something but cannot speak. You kiss
her on the cheek and head for the door.

"I'll be back some day Ma to get you out of this place. And if he's still here I'll kill the sonofabitch!" Unfortunately, you never have the chance to make good on either of these promises.

You run out the door just as he is starting to regain consciousness.
111.title: Money for Nothing

choices: Get out and jump off the overpass to escape.
1111.content:
You start quickly walking away from the house and stick out your thumb, trying to
catch a ride. After several cars pass, eventually an aging VW bus pulls over to give
you a ride.

"Hop in, man." a long-haired guy who looks like Tommy Chong says, as clouds of
smoke waft from the car.

You climb in and shut the door, he grinds the bus into gear, and you are on your
way.

“What’s your name, little dude?” the guy asks.
“Steven.” you say, preferring not to give him your real name.

“I’m Clarence Bonney, but everbody calls me Clyde. Kids started calling me that in
school and it kinda stuck: Clyde Bonney, Bonnie and Clyde, get it? ....So where
you headed, Steve?"

"As far away from here as I can get." you answer.

"I hear that, man." he replies. "You wanna toke?" he asks, handing you a
hand-rolled cigarette.

Although you have never tried marijuana before, you take a puff, and immediately
start coughing, which starts Clyde laughing. "Here, let me show you." he says as
he takes a toke. After a while you get the hang of it, and soon you are feeling quite
fuzzy.

He turns on the radio and you catch part of a Lou Reed song:

"...He's got 9 brothers and sisters,
they're brought up on their knees.
It's hard to run when a coat hanger beats you on the thighs...
Pedro dreams of being older and killing the old man,
but that's a slim chance...
He's going to the boulevard"

You've heard the tune before, listening to the local FM station on headphones in
your room late at night, when everyone was asleep. With all you have been through in your short life, you can definitely relate to the kid in that song...

Just then, flashing blue lights and a siren from behind the car wake you from your
daydream. "Oh shit, it's the cops!" Clyde exclaims.
1111.title: Up in Smoke

choices: A Genie pops out of the vial.
11111.content:
Clyde pulls the bus over to the side of the road.

"Quick, man! Help me hide this stuff!" he says, handing you a bag full of white pills, but you just sit there, frozen, as a cop shines a light through the side window.

"All right boys, step out of the car with your hands on your heads!"

You both comply. One cop shines a light in your eyes, while his partner makes a quick
search of the car and steps back out holding the bag of pills, the bag of marijuana, rolling papers, and a small opaque amber-colored glass vial.

"I'm placing you both under arrest for possession of controlled substances..." the first officer says as he handcuffs you.

"You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say may be used against you in a court of law. You have the right to consult an attorney.." he continues reading you your rights while assisting you into the back seat of the cruiser.

As soon as you are locked in the car and headed towards the Station, the cops start joking around, reviewing the contraband.

"So, what's in the vial, boys? Cocaine?" Cop #1 says, holding it up.

"Hey man, you better not open that up in here!" Clyde says.

Cop #2 responds: "And what's gonna happen if we do? Is a Genie gonna pop out at us? G'wan, Danny, open the bottle, lets see what kinda dope these kids got here!"

Cop #1 unscrews the lid...
11111.title: Busted

111111.content:
Danny opens the bottle and out pops a Genie, or more accurately, out pops a hottie in sheer harem pants and a tight halter top, looking like the Barbara Eden Jeannie from that 60's sitcom.

"Your wish is my command, Master." she says, amiably.

"Anything I want?" the cop asks.

"Certainly, Master, anything," she replies.

The cop takes a good long look at her figure, picturing what she'd look like with her costume off. "Man, I'd sure love to have some of that!" he says to his partner.

"Master, you can have it all, if you wish," Jeannie says to him, brushing her hands across her breasts and down to her hips. "Are you sure this is what you want?"

The cop responds "Oh yeah baby! give it to me now!"

There is a sudden explosion and a flash of light...

Once the smoke clears, the cop looks down and sees that he's now sporting a 36c halter top. He's also rather nicely filling out a pair of women's size ten harem pants, and something that was between his legs before is now suspiciously absent. "AAAAHHH!" he screams in horror.

"I gave you what you wished for, are you not pleased Master?" Jeannie asks innocently.

You figure this is your chance to escape....
111111.title: I Dream of Jeannie

111112.content:
"Hey Charlie, it ain't coke,it's some kinda funny-smelling liquid!" Cop #1 says,
peering into the vial. At that moment the cruiser hits a pothole, knocking the vial
from his hand. It tumbles through the air and splashes on the other cop, causing
him to lose conscoiusness and slump behind the wheel.

The car starts to fill with a pungent ether-like odor as it screeches off the road. The
cruiser tumbles end-over-end several times and lands, miraculously, on all fours at
the bottom of an embankment.
111112.title: Crash!

Hop in the car and hope they aren't looking for a repeat preformance

AS the car rolls to a halt you can see the bodies of the dead cops in the front of the car and start freakin out how can you ever explain this to the cops and even if you do they will make you go back to your dad when they let you go and you know when you get back he'll do more than just beat you till you pass out he will beat you till you die! There really is no choice you have to run and get out of here before someone sees you.

As you step out onto the highway you look around to she if anyone saw what happened, luckly nobody is in view, you safe. For a while!

You start walking down the interstate with your thumb extended hoping despratly for someone to stop soon, and as if they had heard you a car slows to a stop, as you approach the window you notice they are all laughing and you ask them what was up then they tell you they just saw what happened to and the cops and can't believe how cool it was.
1111121.title: Life choices

choices: A woman in a red corvette
A state trooper in a black and white
11111211.content:
Not your scene, you decide, and wave them off. Can't hang here, though, so you start walking away from the wreck with one eye on the road. There is no traffic for quite some time, but you keep walking, afraid to look back.

The night is warm and dry. Walking is comfortable and easy, giving your mind time to flash back over events. You can't get that dream of an apartment, a used car, and a whole adult life out of your head. It was so real, and so different from the horror of the past couple hours. Your real childhood wasn't like this. Somehow, deep inside, you know this, but that doesn't explain the nightmare you find yourself in now.

Insects, crickets and something else, play a night melody all around you. Once in awhile you hear a snatch of birdsong and you wonder if Nightingales are called that because they sing at night. It makes sense, but you can't be sure if it's real.

Slowly, the haze from the marijuana clears away, bringing the world around you back into focus. The road weaves left and right, and begins to incline upward. You must be getting close to some foothills or mountains, but it's hard to see anything past the tall hedges running along both sides of the road. Very few crossroads break up the road you're on, but when they appear, the hedges are cleared for about fifty meters to either side. You suppose you would have quite a good view of the surrounding countryside if the moon was up. Unfortunately, it's not, so you can never see more than a few yards through the openings.

In the distance, you suddenly notice a new sound. An engine somewhere down the road. You stop walking and listen as carefully as you can. As far as you can tell, it's a fairly new car, and coming up behind you at normal speed.

Praying it's not some kind of cops, you stick out your thumb and wait for it to approach.
11111211.title: Walking in darkness

choices: She drops you off at an all-night coffee shop
She takes you to her house
111112111.content:
Sleek and gurgling pleasantly, the car that finally approaches is a fire engine red, mid-seventies Corvette. To your surprise, it pulls off the road just a few yards beyond you. The driver's side door opens and a young woman steps out. She's only sixteen or seventeen, with cedar-red hair and a pale complexion. From the distance you can see her mildly plump body is wrapped in designer jeans and a pale green blouse that looks like silk. When you get closer you can see the silk matches her eyes.

"Long way from nowhere," she says, her voice a sort of cross between a buzzsaw and a violin that is far from sultry, but not at all unpleasant.

"Got lost," you mutter, realizing too late your voice is barely a whisper.

She frowns, the hand on the roof of the car begins tapping out an annoyed drumming.

"Cat got your tongue? How old are you, anyway? Are you even in junior high?"

For a horrified moment you absolutely cannot remember how old you are. You want to say thirty-five, but you know there is no way you are that old, at least, not anymore. Then it comes to you, creeping in like a memory of a memory, you passed your fourteenth birthday a couple months ago and just finished eighth grade.

A sad frown passes over your features when you remember that you were really looking forward to starting high school in a couple months, but now that's never going to happen.

"Whoa, hey," she suddenly says. "I didn't mean to upset you! Whatever put you out here in the middle of nowhere can't be good. Hop in and I'll give you a ride, at least as far as town."

"I'm fourteen," you say, much louder and a bit too defiant, but it's too late now. "I can't help it if I'm small."

She laughs then, lighting up her eyes and jiggling her modest bosom in a way that sends sparks shooting through your groin. When you blush uncontrollably she laughs again, completely unaware of what's really embarrassed you.

"C'mon then," she waves at the far door, "climb in and I'll take you into town. Maybe the buses are still running and you can get home that way."

Resigned and still uncomfortable, you awkwardly climb into the passenger seat. You don't know where you're going, but you do know you aren't going home.
111112111.title: Sporty red

1111122.content:
You just hadta click on this link, didn't you? Well, here's how it goes, and it's not a
pretty picture:

Unfortunately, the cops didn't bother to fasten your seat belts after the arrest, so
you were thrown out midway through the second roll. The cops were belted in
though and had air bags, so aside from a few bruises, they were OK.

Your "partner in crime" although unbelted, managed to stay in the car, suffering
only a minor lump on the head and a sprained wrist...

The three occupants slowly regain consciousness, the noxious vapors in the cruiser having evaporated through the broken windows.

"Are you alright son?" the cop asks Clyde, pulling him from the car.

"Take it easy on the arm, man! Hey, where's the little dude?" he asks.

They look around and eventually find your body beneath a rock face, your neck twisted, blood and brain matter sprayed across the ground nearby.

"Poor kid never had a chance..." "Hey Charlie, call the station, let 'em know what's up... Damn, I'm not looking forward to the paperwork on this one."

“Me either, probably take half the night...and I was supposed to go out to dinner with the old lady after shift change... have lasagna at the Olive Garden..."

Author’s Note: There is a lesson to be learned here: Always wear your seat belt. Although this chapter is only a work of fiction, parts of it are based on my observation as a witness to a major traffic accident in which a man was killed who would otherwise have survived...
if only he had buckled up.
1111122.title: Buckle Up for Safety

11112.content:
Clyde pulls the VW over to the side of the road with the police car behind,
preparing for the inevitable. Paranoid and not thinking too clearly, you jump from
the car and start running.

"POLICE! STOP!" the bullhorn shouts. You jump over the railing of the overpass,
not thinking, just reacting...

But it's a long way down.

"...fly fly away, from this dirty boulevard
I want to fly, from dirty boulevard
I want to fly, from dirty boulevard
I want to fly-fly-fly-fly, from the dirty boulevard..."

The Lou Reed song echoes through your head as you fly through the air to land
face-down on the pavement, fracturing your skull and breaking several ribs.
Seconds later a White Freightliner carrying a flatbed of steel comes roaring down
the hill under the overpass. The driver sees you lying in the road, but by the time
he reacts and slams on the brakes you are under his back tires. Your body is
ground into hamburger on the pavement as the truck screeches to a halt...

... If this ending is too dark for you, go back to the previous chapter and take the other
route. In all fairness though, you should have known better than to jump off a freeway
overpass.
11112.title: Dirty Boulevard

112.content:
You grab a couple of extension cords and tie your father up securely and call the police.
Your mom is just finishing wrapping bandages on your fingers as the cops arrive. You and
your mother explain the chain of events, and the police slap the cuffs on the old man just
as he is regaining consciousness.

"I'll kill you both!" he rages, but the cops keep a tight grip on him.

"I'll need you two to come down town and sign a statement. With this guy's history and
your cooperation, we can put him away for thirty years!" Officer O'Malley says.

You and your mother agree, and you follow the police car down to the station...

In the coming weeks, now that your father is safely in prison, your mom really takes
charge of things. She manages to get free training through a state run program to get her real estate broker's license. In the coming years she becomes quite a good agent in the booming market, an even gets an award for the most closings in the district one year.

By the time you graduate high school she has put aside enough money to send you to an
upscale university, where you major in business, eventually graduating with honors and pursuing a career as an extremely successful investment banker. You take some of your financial winnings and buy her a nice home on the island of Bermuda, where she has always wanted to live, and there she enjoys a well deserved retirement...

... Now you know in real life, given the circumstances of the people involved, a chain of events with a fairy-tale ending like this is highly improbable. And given the dark nature of this story, such events are even more unlikely here. So if you want to find out what really happens, go back to the previous chapter and take the other path.

Best of luck to you.
112.title: And They Lived Happily Ever After
